title: Mediocre FPS on High End PC
body:
My PC has a 1070, i7 6700k, an ssd, etc and yet when i play league it's only around 150 fps in laning and 60-80 in teamfights. I feel it should be significantly higher due my specs and i should be able to play with 144 fps the whole time but it simply drops for seemingly no reason.
Looking at my gpu during gameplay and it's usage is only 25%~ even with framerate uncapped.
I'd love to know if there was a way to get higher fps so i can not have drops, and it's only league as i can play witcher 3/watch dogs 2/ etc on ultra settings with good fps but league is still poor performance.

replies.body:
(Not a solution, just my 2 cents)
Just lock it at 60 or 80 tbh. Better to not have frames go up or down by 10/20 if you're playing mechanically intensive champions.

Are you running the Xbox Game DVR feature when you play League? I ask this because this feature has caused some massive FPS issues in the past. I'd recommend working through [**this guide**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to disable the Game Bar, which is where the Xbox feature lies.

Let me know if this caused a change in your framerate.
I turned that off recently and it marginally helped but I still have most the problems I talked about.

Are you running the 375.xx Nvidia Driver version? I've seen some FPS issues going on with the newer versions of the nvidia driver. I'd like you to try rolling back to an older driver, such as the 372.xx one [**here.**](http://www.nvidia.com/download/driverResults.aspx/107564/en-us)

Please let me know if you experienced better or worse FPS stability on this driver.
